Calculate index based on classification scheme

Source: R/index_fun.R
index_fun.Rd

Calculate index based on classification scheme

index(x, ...)

# S3 method for data.frame
index(x, ...)

# S3 method for matrix
index(x, by = NULL, from = NULL, ...)

Arguments

x

output from classify (or possibly from as.data.frame.classified)
...

used internally
by

name of column with 'weights' from corresponding classcodes object. Can be omitted if the index is just the count of relevant classes.
from

classcodes object. Can be omitted if information already present as attribute of x (which is often the case) and/or if index calculated without weights.

Value

Named numeric index vector with names corresponding to rownames(x)

See also

Other verbs: add, classify, codify

Examples


# Calculate Elixhauser comorbidity index
cl <- classify(c("C80", "I20"), "elix_icd10")
index(cl)
#> index calculated as number of relevant categories
#> C80 I20 
#>   1   0 

# Calculate Charlson-index using original weights
cl <- classify(c("C80", "I21"), "charlson_icd10")
index(cl, "quan_original")
#> C80 I21 
#>   6   1 

# Calculate Charlson-index using updated weights
cl <- classify(c("C80", "I21"), "charlson_icd10")
index(cl, "quan_updated")
#> C80 I21 
#>   6   0 


# Find patients with adverse events after hip surgery
co <- codify(ex_people, ex_icd10, id = "name",
    date = "surgery", days = c(-365, 0))
cl <- classify(co, "hip_adverse_events_icd10_old")
index(cl)
#> index calculated as number of relevant categories
